musicTheory:
{"Chromatic Descent":{"theory":"Diatonic
< Info >
 in scale","music":""},"New Theory":{"theory":"Chromatic
< Info >
Not in scale

- Chromatic Accenting
< Info >
A melodic line moving up by semitones

- Chromatic Descenting
< Info >
A melodic line moving down by semitones","music":""},"Pedal Note":{"theory":"Pedal Note
< Info >
A sustained, repeated low note, usually in the bass, over which the harmony changes","music":""},"New Theory 1":{"theory":"Line Cliche
< Info >
A line cliché is a stepwise line (either descending or ascending) that moves against a single stationary chord.


< Characteristics >
• They usually occur at the top or bottom (often using slash chords) of a chord voicing, but may also occur in the middle;
• The line movement is always in the root, 5th or 7th (never the 3rd);
• They are generally found on minor chords, but can occasionally be found on Major chords;
• They are generally found on the Tonic chord, but can occasionally be found on other chords;
• They can ascend, descend or change direction;
• They usually move in semitones, but can move in tones.","music":""},"New Theory 2":{"theory":"Chord Substitution
< Info >
technique of using a chord in place of another in a progression of chords, or a chord progression.

- Function
< Info >
the role a musical element (like a chord or note) plays in a progression, creating tension and release

[ T ] 
1, 3, 6
[ SD ] 
2, 4
[ D ]
5, 7

- Model Interchange
< Info >
Borrow chords from a parallel key to add harmonic color, tension, and variety without fully changing keys.

1 ( Ionian, Lydian, Mixolydian )
1 > 1m ( Dorian, Phrygian, Minor )

2m ( Ionian, Dorian, Mixolydian )
2m > 2 ( Lyrdian )
2m > b2 ( Phrygian, Locrian)

3m ( Ionian, Lydian )
3m > b3 ( Dorian, Phrygian, Aeolian )
3m > b3m ( Locrian )

4 ( Ionian, Dorian, Mixolydian )
4 > 4m ( Phrygian, Aeolian, Locrian )
4 > #4o ( Lydian )

5 ( Ionian, Lydian )
5 > 5m ( Dorian, Mixolydian, Aeolian )
5 > 5o ( Phrygian, Locrian )

6m ( Ionian, Lydian, Phrygian )
6m > b6 ( Phrygian, Aeolian, Locrian )
6m > 6o ( Dorian )

7o ( Ionian )
7o > 7m ( Lydian )
7o > b7 ( Dorain, Mixolydian, Aeolian )
7o > b7m ( Phrygian, Locrian )

- Axis System
< Info >
a harmonic theory that expands tonal function by grouping the 12 chromatic tones into three axes (tonic, dominant, subdominant) based on minor third and tritone relationships.

[ T ]
Primary
C, F#
Secondary
A, Eb

[ SD ]
Primary
F, B
Secondary
D, Ab

[ D ]
Primary
G, C#
Secondary
E, Bb","music":""},"New Theory 3":{"theory":"Chord Extension
< Info >
Add color and complexity to basic chords (triads) by adding notes

13 > M7, m7, 7, 7sus4
b13 > 7, ø

#11  > M7, M6, 7
11 > m, sus4

#9 > 7
9 > M, m, sus, 7, o, ø
b9 > 7, 7sus4, ø","music":""}}
theoryOrder: ["Chromatic Descent","New Theory","Pedal Note","New Theory 1","New Theory 2","New Theory 3"]
